result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal N Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation review hearing March 25, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.
Probation review hearing June 3, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.
**6/3/2016  Probation review hearing August 26, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.  Probation extended to 18 months total.  Court allowed only if defendant correlates test with work and can find BIP sessions on Saturdays.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9), the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

-No contact with victim Jamar C.;
-No contact with firearms.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's an absconder and will most likely be revoked. DOC warrant already issued.  DOC not requesting condition time. Review hearing is cancelled.

ERROR IS Probation term  showing 18  months in the "length" portion on JOC.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Defendant Crystal N Thompson in court PRO SE.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation. Court amended JOC to reflect 40 days condition time stayed. Court also amended JOC to reflect probation extended to 18 months total. Court allowed only if defendant correlates tests with work and can find BIP sessions on Saturdays. The remaining condition time is stayed. Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Crystal N Thompson in court PRO SE.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is somewhat compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Crystal N Thompson in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served, with Huber privileges.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No contact with victim Jamar C.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.


Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Case adjourned for Probation Review Hearing in branch 24.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 40.

Defendant Crystal N Thompson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams. Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT in custody, defense no longer wishes to argue bail. Final pre-trial scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Crystal N Thompson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Crystal N Thompson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
